abstract: Afro-Cubans have long been pushed to the margins. The leaders of the post-Castro era must work to change the course of history.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Cuba under Fidel and Raúl Castro saw its share of No. 3 men. Occupying the country’s most visible position of power after the Castros meant that getting the boot was always a possibility, and perhaps even an inevitability.
